intro: Schoenoplectus litoralis, commonly known as salt marsh bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to coastal regions of North America. It thrives in brackish and saline wetlands, often found in estuaries and tidal marshes. The plant has tall, cylindrical stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height, with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowering spikes produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. Schoenoplectus litoralis plays a vital role in stabilizing shorelines and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
